availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George D. McKinney (Mercer County, Ky, student & pvt 9th Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Hardin McKinney and Ellinor Cole McKinney. Resident of Mercer County in 1850. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from August 22, 1862, to September 11, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 318B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 673.
Find A Grave, "George David McKinney (1843-1920)," Memorial #177893964, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/177893964/george-david-mckinney (accessed July 14, 2021).
Indiana Death Certificates, 1900â€“2011, Indiana State Department of Health and Vital Records, Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Indianapolis, IN, Certificate #16542.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 245.
